entry.title: Mail Order
entry.content:
Late Friday afternoon, I purchased three software products from Apple online. I price shopped Amazon.com as well, but Amazon.com was unable to satisfactorily compute my shipping or tax burdens (the software I wanted to purchase would have shipped from two different firms: Amazon.com and JR Music and Video or some such operation). The quoted Amazon price, including shipping, and vague on taxes, was only about 8 dollars less expensive than the total Apple price, but Apple was certain about my tax burden and providing free shipping, so I went with Apple.

Yesterday, two of the three products ordered arrived on my doorstep, prior to the quoted shipping date.
